name: Le Meridien Parkhotel Frankfurt

reviews.text: I had an awesome stay in this Hotel. Great location ( near central station) and great service. Huge compliment to the staff.
reviews.title: Great!
Above average
reviews.text: I stayed at the Le Meredian in Frankfurt early in February. While this is part of the SPG, I personally didn't like the rooms as they were very small and cramped ( despite an upgrade). They don't provide a complimentary breakfast and at 27 euros, I think that is a rip off. The bar is nice and quite and so is the restaurant at the ground floor.. the area is close to the night life place and that can beboth a positive and a negative, based on who you are and what you are looking to do.

We stayed here during a recent trip to Frankfurt for a trade show at the Messe. In the past, we stayed at the Sheraton at the airport, but decided to try something different this time. I'm glad we did. The Le Meridien is very close (easy walking distance) to the main train station, from which it is a short train, subway, or tram ride to the Messe, which is also only a 15 minute walk away. I was originally concerned by some of the postings on Tripadvisor that mention the proximity of the red light district to the train station, but it wasn't an issue at all.
reviews.title: Looking forward to staying there again

reviews.text: The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. The best part was the friendly service. I wasn't used to the staff remembering my name since I usually stay in a more impersonal, larger hotel. It was a nice touch. I especially appreciated being able to check-in very early since I had just arrived from an overnight flight.
reviews.title: Not up to Meridien standards

reviews.text: One downside is that there's no WiFi in the rooms. I was travelling with an iPad rather than a laptop this time, so I couldn't use it in the room since the iPad only has wireless internet.
reviews.title: Not LeMeridian Quality

reviews.text: Service level at breakfast (buffet breakfast is actually not bad, but pricey) is again very "european". They make you feel almost embrassed to ask for more coffee.
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.text: Overall I'd rate this hotel as quite expensive for what they offer.
reviews.title: Location not ideal for everyone but service and rooms lovely

reviews.text: My recent stay was less than spectacular; thank goodness it was only one night. I stayed here due to the proximity to the train station - it is very, very close. I've stayed at the tall Marriott down the street on prior visits, but became bored of mediocre service. The service at LeMeridian is better, but not stellar. My chief gripe here was the extremely small room size and the expensive internet fees. The bar is a good meeting place but drinks are expensive. Will probably return to the Marriott - at least you can snag a view there ,which is more than I can say for LeMeridian.
reviews.title: The worse Le Meridien of the chain

reviews.text: Location is my only negative on this hotel - its near the main station, so will be ideal for some, however, if you prefer to walk around a small city centre like Frankfurt as you can from many other city hotels, you will find this one too far from the centre and on the edge of a less salubrious part of town
reviews.title: Good Hotel But Tiny Rooms For the Price
Le Meridien without "Le Meriden personality"
reviews.text: As a platinum member with more than 200 nights spent in the Le Meridien I have to say that the Frankfurt one is the worse one of the chain.

I transit Frankfurt often and continually look for a good hotel for short overnights without paying for the Villa Kennedy. Among the options I've tried in Frankfurt, the LeMeridien is my least favorite for two reasons:
reviews.title: Just Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Room quality and size is inferior to the competition and below that of other LeMeridien hotels I've visited. My room was small, even by European standards, and a bit spartan for a 5-star property. Nothing specifically wrong with the room, just small and unmemorable...and good 5-star properties should be memorable.
reviews.title: Nice, but...

reviews.text: 2. Uninspired service. This property is one of several SPG properties I've experienced that absolutely wants to do nothing for you in terms of rooms as an SPG Gold member. I was first given a room on a low floor in a poor location and it took quite a bit of insistence to receive a basic room in a somewhat better location.
reviews.title: Reliable Service but the rooms do not meet the le Meridien standards

reviews.text: The Westin is a better Starwood option in my opinion, though the Hilton is my favorite choice for a short stay in Frankfurt.
reviews.title: Reasonable rooms but unreliable service

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. It's across the street from the train station.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frankfurt is often an in-transit city for us when we are in Europe. Last Christmas/New Year's season were spent 2 nights at the Le Meridien Park, both very comfortable. The first night we had a large room, with a separate office/sitting room area, which was great for all the luggage we had. We returned to the same hotel (a 5-10 min walk from the main train station) after our weekend in Paris, and this time we got a smaller room, with 2 twin beds (not a king like the first time), no sitting room etc, but still functional. Our second night in a smaller room was not a problem as we arrived VERY late due to train delays, and had to be at the airport first thing in the morning. Overall, we had no complaints about the hotel, it is nicely modern and the location is fantastic if you plan in taking the train.
reviews.title: Modern, convenient, comfortable

reviews.text: Near the railway station but still quiet from the outside to the inside.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel with attentive staff

reviews.text: Perfect service, outgoing people, very good atmosphere, lovley rooms (Palais Wing), did enjoy the casablanca bar very much, good food, very friendly & helpfull front office staff
reviews.title: an experience!

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night. Room was contemporary and clean. Location is very convenient, just 1 minute from the trainstation, which means you are e.g. at the airport in 15 minutes. Service was good. I tried the restaurant, it was good without being too overpriced. Internet was at a charge, not ludicrulously expensive. Sometimes good rates can be found.
reviews.title: Excellent for train connections, clean and functional

reviews.text: Due to the snow I missed my flight and was put here by Lufthansa.
reviews.title: To be stuck here is not a punishment!

reviews.text: It's a very good hotel, with good food, nice rooms, great bathroom and modern rooms with LCD, etc.
reviews.title: Great stay very close to railway but without the noise or the sleezy area feel that you get near a central station

reviews.text: Good breakfast, with smoked salmon.
reviews.title: Several issues and reasons not to got there - rooms, staff, and no real attraction

aka: Le Meridien Parkhotel Frankfurt Hotel Frankfurt
description: Perfect symbiosis between classic grand and trendy lifestyle hotel at the heart of Frankfurt. In 2007 all the rooms in the Business Wing were completely refurbished along with the public areas and hotel restaurant. This five-star hotel's modern, cosmopolitan atmosphere on the idyllic square Wiesenhuettenplatz provides a marvelous contrast to the pulsating metropolis of Frankfurt.
